items.name: Ext.data.JsonP
request
items.text: Makes a JSONP request.

items.name: options
items.text:
An object which may contain the following properties. Note that options will take priority over any defaults that are specified in the class.
  • url : String
    The URL to request.
  • params : Object (Optional)
    An object containing a series of key value pairs that will be sent along with the request.
  • timeout : Number (Optional)
    See timeout
  • callbackKey : String (Optional)
    See callbackKey
  • callbackName : String (Optional)
    The function name to use for this request. By default this name will be auto-generated: Ext.data.JsonP.callback1, Ext.data.JsonP.callback2, etc. Setting this option to "my_name" will force the function name to be Ext.data.JsonP.my_name. Use this if you want deterministic behavior, but be careful - the callbackName should be different in each JsonP request that you make.
  • disableCaching : Boolean (Optional)
    See disableCaching
  • disableCachingParam : String (Optional)
    See disableCachingParam
  • success : Function (Optional)
    A function to execute if the request succeeds.
  • failure : Function (Optional)
    A function to execute if the request fails.
  • callback : Function (Optional)
    A function to execute when the request completes, whether it is a success or failure.
  • scope : Object (Optional)
    The scope in which to execute the callbacks: The "this" object for the callback function. Defaults to the browser window.
request An object containing the request details.

items.name: abort
items.text:
Abort a request. If the request parameter is not specified all open requests will
be aborted.

items.name: request
items.text: (Optional) The request to abort

items.name: setupErrorHandling
items.text: Sets up error handling for the script

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: handleAbort
items.text: Handles any aborts when loading the script

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: handleError
items.text: Handles any script errors when loading the script

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: cleanupErrorHandling
items.text: Cleans up anu script handling errors

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: handleTimeout
items.text: Handle any script timeouts

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: handleResponse
items.text: Handle a successful response

items.name: result
items.text: The result from the request

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: createScript
items.text:
Create the script tag given the specified url, params and options. The options
parameter is passed to allow an override to access it.

items.name: url
items.text: The url of the request

items.name: params
items.text: Any extra params to be sent

items.name: options
items.text: The object passed to request.

items.name: loadScript
items.text: Loads the script for the given request by appending it to the HEAD element. This is its own method so that users can override it (as well as createScript).

items.name: request
items.text: The request object.

items.name: requestCount
items.text: Number of requests done so far.

items.name: requests
items.text: Hash of pending requests.

items.name: timeout
items.text:
A default timeout for any JsonP requests. If the request has not completed in this time the
failure callback will be fired. The timeout is in ms. Defaults to <tt>30000</tt>.

items.name: disableCaching
items.text: True to add a unique cache-buster param to requests. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>.

items.name: disableCachingParam
items.text: Change the parameter which is sent went disabling caching through a cache buster. Defaults to <tt>'_dc'</tt>.

items.name: callbackKey
items.text:
Specifies the GET parameter that will be sent to the server containing the function name to be executed when
the request completes. Defaults to <tt>callback</tt>. Thus, a common request will be in the form of
url?callback=Ext.data.JsonP.callback1
